newsitem.title: USA: SmithKline heart drug Coreg available in U.S.
newsitem.headline: SmithKline heart drug Coreg available in U.S.

text.p: SmithKline Beecham said Monday that its heart drug Coreg is now available for sale in the U.S.
Coreg, which is being being co-promoted with Boehringer Mannheim Corp, is a treatment for patients with hypertension and those with mild or moderate congestive heart failure.
The company said the drug combines non-selective beta-blocking and vasodilating properties, and is the first agent of its type to be available in the United States for the heart-failure indication.

An estimated 4.8 million Americans have congestive heart failure, a syndrome in which the heart fails to maintain adequate circulation of the blood because of a dysfunction in the pumping action of the heart, said the company.
SmithKline Beecham is British pharmaceutical company. Privately-held Boehringer Mannheim, a German company, said in May it expects to merge with Swiss-based Roche Holding Ltd.
